title: What are the specifications of the Redmi Note 9? - Quora

response.answer_text: Redmi Note 9 launched on 30th April 2020. This smartphone has been one of the most talked about device in the recent times due to various reasons, however, the most anticipated reason being the launch of a new MediaTek processor along with the phone. We shall get into that alongside the other specifications of the phone as well. The expected price of Redmi Note 9 in India is Rs.11,990. The phone comes with a 6.53-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 1080 x 2340 pixels and an aspect ratio of 19:5:9. The new Redmi Note 9 is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Helio G85 processor with 3GB of RAM. An all new MediaTek processor! The MediaTek Helio G85 is a 12nm chipset with 2x Cortex-A72 cluster clocked at 2.0GHz plus another 6x Cortex-A55. Helio G85 has Mali G52 MC2, with the clock speed set at 1000MHz. It also comes with MediaTek’s HyperEngine, which ensures the best power-efficient and reliable performance this chipset can deliver during gaming. Therefore, any doubts regarding the performance of this chipset is insignificant.  Redmi Note 9 runs MIUI 11 based on Android 10 and packs 64GB of inbuilt storage. There is also the option of expanding the memory up to 128GB via a MicroSD card with a dedicated slot. The Redmi Note 9 is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) smartphone that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The phone measures up to 162.30(height) x 77.20 (width) x 8.90mm (thickness). The Redmi Note 9 runs Android 10 and is powered by a massive 5020mAh battery. The Redmi Note 9 supports propriety fast charging. The Redmi Note 9 comes with a 48-megapixel primary camera + a second 8-megapixel camera + a third 2-megapixel camera + a fourth 2-megapixel camera rear. It also features autofocus. There is a 13-megapixel camera on the front. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, 3G and 4G, GPS, Bluetooth, USB Type-C. Sensors included are accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, proximity sensor, face unlock and fingerprint sensor. There are three color variants available for the new Redmi Note 9- Midnight Grey, Polar White and Forest Green.

Xiaomi launched the Redmi Note 9 few months earlier. The new Note 9 has joined its predecessors, the Redmi Note 9 Pro and the Redmi Note Pro Max, which were launched earlier in the year. Packed with a massive same 5,020mAh battery, the Note 9 supports 18W fast charging. It has a punch-hole design in the front where the front camera is placed. It has a trendy design and comes in the colour variants of Forest Green, Midnight Grey, and Polar White colour.  The Redmi Note 9 is powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 octa-core processor with up to 4GB of RAM. The Redmi Note 9 comes with a 128GB inbuilt storage that can be expanded via a microSD card (up to 128GB). The MediaTek Helio G series is known for its pioneering technology for optimal performance for smartphones. Connectivity options for the Redmi Note 9 include Wi-Fi 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, 4G VoLTE, Bluetooth v5.0, a 3.5mm audio jack, NFC (select markets), Infrared (IR) blaster, GPS, A-GPS, and a USB Type-C port for charging the phone. The new Redmi Note 9 comes in two variants of storage of 3GB with an inbuilt storage of 64GB and the second one with 4GB of RAM and an inbuilt storage of 128GB both can be expanded with a microSD card. The first version is priced roughly at Rs. 15,100 while the second variant is priced at Rs. 18,900. The new Redmi Note 9 has dual-SIM (Nano) compatibility and runs MIUI 11, based on Android 10. The Note 9 also comes with a 6.53-inch full-HD+ IPS display with an aspect ratio of 19.5:9 and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The new Redmi Note 9 measures 162.3x77.2x8.9mm and weighs 199 grams. The phone also comes with a quad-camera setup at the back with a 48-megapixel Samsung GM1 primary sensor along with a 13- megapixel selfie camera for the front.
